channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump's election order could jeopardize 'hundreds of thousands' of future mail ballots
item.description: Eighteen states count mail-in ballots that are received after Election Day, but a new order by President Trump challenges the practice.

item.title: Bienvenidos! Some colleges are targeting a long-neglected group: Hispanic students
item.description: Colleges are recognizing the importance of this growing pool of potential students.

item.title: Trump defends new tariffs. And, Supreme Court backs Trump in deportation case
item.description: President Trump defended his new tariffs and asked for patience as experts warn of economic repercussions. And, immigration advocates worry about SCOT...

item.title: World markets regain some ground after Trump tariffs shock investors
item.description: After major slides in equity trading across the world, any slight uptick in stock prices will only repair part of the destruction of trillions of doll...

item.title: It's sexual assault awareness month and HHS just gutted its rape prevention unit
item.description: The CDC teams that supported local sexual assault prevention groups were 'wiped out' in RFK Jr.'s overhaul of the Department of Health and Human Servi...

item.title: Clean energy's share of world's electricity reaches 40%, report says
item.description: More clean electricity was generated in 2024 but there was a rise in the amount of coal and gas burnt too.

item.title: 4/7: America Decides
item.description: President Trump says he’s not looking at pausing tariffs; Senator Bernie Sanders discusses taking on the Trump administration

item.title: South Sudan says US visa ban caused by mistaken nationality
item.description: The government says the man it refused entry to was Congolese, not South Sudanese as the US had said.

item.title: When is the next total solar eclipse in the U.S.?
item.description: The next solar eclipses where parts of he continental U.S. will experience totality won't be until 2044 and 2045.

item.title: Swollen rivers flood towns in the US South and Midwest
Rocket carrying NASA's Jonny Kim, 2 cosmonauts docks with space station
item.description: The craft carrying astronaut Jonny Kim and two Russian cosmonauts docked with the space station. They're scheduled for an eight-month stay.

item.title: Kentucky watches for surging rivers to recede so widespread cleanup can begin
item.description: After days of unrelenting downpours swelled rivers to near record levels across Kentucky, residents are closely monitoring waterways for signs they ar...

item.title: Overseas financial markets and U.S. futures rebound after wild day on Wall Street
item.description: Overseas shares and U.S. futures advanced Tuesday markets calmed somewhat after the shocks from President Trump 's tariff hikes.

item.title: South Korea says about 10 North Korean troops crossed their border
item.description: South Korea fired warning shots after, Seoul says, North Korean troops crossed their border. The soldiers then went back to the North, Seoul said.

item.title: China is not backing down from Trump's tariff war. What next?
item.description: The US-China trade war shows no signs of slowing down, leaving the world unsure of what to expect.

item.title: Inquiry after Indian man filmed giving water to cheetahs
item.description: The footage shows a female cheetah and her four cubs walk up to the pan and start drinking from it.

item.title: Menendez brothers feel 'hope' for parole after decades in jail
item.description: The pair tell TMZ they are optimistic about their latest appeals over their parents' killing in 1996.

item.title: Colleges around the US say some international students’ visas are being revoked
